p: The native shrubs Acaena splendens, Senecio bracteolatus and Azorella prolifera had the highest levels of cover in the reference areas. This functional group was also abundant at the roadsides, being A. splendens the dominant species. This species is a ruderal shrub [ sensu 79] that frequently colonizes sandy and degraded soils [ 80], and could be a key species for restoration, since it has been reported to act as a nurse species that facilitates recruitment of native seedlings of high forage value, as well as other species in arid ecosystems [ 81].
